update.description:
This pull request prevents users from running Segway with incorrect include-coords or validation-coords files.

Specifically in the current version Segway runs and crashes after hours of computation if the coord files contain chromosomes that are not in the genomedata archive.

This PR aims to solve this issue by

- comparing the chromosomes from the coord files with the a genomdata archive before running a task
- raising a Value Error if the coord file has extra chromosomes
- reporting the chromosomes causing the issue to help users fixing it

This PR does not verify if the regions defined in the coord files exceed the chromosome sizes of the genomedata archives as it might be more relevant to issue #31. However it can be easily added if needed.
update.title: Check external chrom

content.html: This part of the docstring (ext_chromosomes) was still not fixed in your latest commit.

content.raw: Getting all the chromosomes names form all archives is quite long in my case where I have more than 100 archives this is why I assume that the first archive is representative of all the others. In this case the assumption is correct because I call the function after `check_genomedata_archives()`. I'll add this to the docstring
content.html: Getting all the chromosomes names form all archives is quite long in my case where I have more than 100 archives this is why I assume that the first archive is representative of all the others. In this case the assumption is correct because I call the function after check_genomedata_archives(). I'll add this to the docstring

content.raw: There is no literal syntax for an empty set in python. `{}` is the literal syntax for an empty dict
content.html: There is no literal syntax for an empty set in python. {} is the literal syntax for an empty dict

content.raw:
As far as I understand, Segway only query exclude-coords instead of iterating through it. It means that it never uses chromosomes defined in exclude-coords to query an archive and thus should never crash.
I can run a small test if needed
content.html: As far as I understand, Segway only query exclude-coords instead of iterating through it. It means that it never uses chromosomes defined in exclude-coords to query an archive and thus should never crash. I can run a small test if needed

content.raw:
Minor: I'm not sure if `ext`/external is the right adjective/noun for this description. This function is simply checking if the chromosomes exist in the given archive(s). Something like `is_chromsome_names_exist` or something to that effect?
Note that the `ext` part of `ext_chromosomes` is not too relevant since the function doesn't really care where the chromosome names come from.
content.html: Minor: I'm not sure if ext/external is the right adjective/noun for this description. This function is simply checking if the chromosomes exist in the given archive(s). Something like is_chromsome_names_exist or something to that effect? Note that the ext part of ext_chromosomes is not too relevant since the function doesn't really care where the chromosome names come from.

content.raw: Please update the NEWS with this feature
content.html: Please update the NEWS with this feature

content.raw: Probably makes more sense to use an empty set notation of `{}` instead of the constructor.
content.html: Probably makes more sense to use an empty set notation of {} instead of the constructor.

content.raw: You can throw the conditional into a list comprehension above. You might consider even including the resulting list comprehension into the following `update` method below.
content.html: You can throw the conditional into a list comprehension above. You might consider even including the resulting list comprehension into the following update method below.

content.raw: You might want to add in a comment that this assumes all archives have matching chromosomes. Or you can add code that gets all chromosome names from all archives. This is not massively breaking since this is a sanity check but you still have the same problem if say, the first archive has missing data for all but 1 chromosome.
content.html: You might want to add in a comment that this assumes all archives have matching chromosomes. Or you can add code that gets all chromosome names from all archives. This is not massively breaking since this is a sanity check but you still have the same problem if say, the first archive has missing data for all but 1 chromosome.
